title: Milos Raonic Announces Retirement: A Retrospective on His Tennis Legacy
summary: Milos Raonic, the Canadian tennis professional renowned for his formidable serve, has formally announced his retirement at age 35, concluding a career that peaked in 2016 with a Wimbledon final appearance and a world ranking of three. His career highlights include eight tour-level titles and four Masters 1000 finals, though he faced defeats against elite opponents such as Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal. Raonic expressed profound gratitude, describing himself as the 'luckiest person' for realizing his childhood dreams, having begun tennis at eight years old. His final competitive match occurred at the 2024 Olympics, ending in a first-round loss. Born in Titograd, Yugoslavia, and relocating to Canada as a child, Raonic's journey underscores the intersection of talent and perseverance. In his retirement statement, he emphasized ongoing motivation, pledging to channel the same intensity into future pursuits, thus marking a transition from athletic obsession to new life chapters.
